regions.name: Noxis
regions.description: The largest region of Nox, Noxis's authority over the surrounding lands has waned since the fall of Celestia and the scattering of her church.

regions.name: Vorsan Rest
regions.description: The island's isolation grants it a degree of autonomy from the religious factions of the mainland. It trades rare exotic resources and curios not found on the elsewhere.

regions.name: Furst Cradle
regions.description: The oldest inhabited regions in Nox, this territory was among the first known refuges of humankind.

regions.name: Calis
regions.description: Once a sparse desert region, Calis has swelled with power and population. Now home to the Godhold, it struggles to sustain its rapid growth. Yet under the brutal authority of the Custodiate, order is maintained and its political influence continues to grow.

locations.name: Hewden
locations.description: This timber town is centered around a busy woodmill. It supplies lumber to Noxis, sending it downstream along the River Blest.

locations.name: Bracken
locations.description: An isolated mining town built beside rich iron veins. It is reachable only by ferry.

locations.name: The Fangs (Northern)
locations.description: Once built to guard against monsters from the nearby swamplands, these twin watchtowers now also regulate travel and trade between Calis and Noxis as political tensions continue to rise.

locations.name: The Fangs (Southern)
locations.description: Once built to guard against monsters from the nearby swamplands, these twin watchtowers now also regulate travel and trade between Calis and Noxis as political tensions continue to rise.

locations.name: The River Blest
locations.description: The River Blest's steady current enables swift transport of goods and people between cities, nourishing the fields, linking provinces, it serves as the lifeblood of Noxis.

locations.name: Vessan
locations.description: The walled capital of Vorsan Rest, known for its colorful markets and unique exotic architecture. The Merchant Guild rules from its heart, where wealth holds more power than faith.

locations.name: Glimmerfols
locations.description: Snowmelt tumbles from the high peaks in a towering sheet of ice-cold water, veiling the cliffs below in glimmering mist.

locations.name: Grimholt Forest
locations.description: Part of Grimholt Forest, this region grows sparser as the trees thin toward the salty shoreline.

locations.name: Grimholt Forest
locations.description: An immense forest stretching beyond the world inhabited by man.

locations.name: Kraken Loch
locations.description: The largest lake, Kraken Loch sees little merchant traffic. Northern and southern ports could link supply between Furstholm to Solis, but piracy and sea creatures make the waters perilous.

locations.name: Kraken's Shame
locations.description: The smallest river inlet to Kraken Loch. It is said to be a half tentacle, but many joke that it refers to another part of the Kraken's anatomy.

locations.name: Kraken's Tongue
locations.description: This river wears at the eastern side of the Bashan Wall. But, its sheer cliff-face makes it nigh impenetrable.

locations.name: The Noose
locations.description: This river seperates Furst Cradle from the main territories of Nox. It wears at the western side of the Bashan Wall.

locations.name: Old Watch
locations.description: A watchtower that once defended against pirates and pillagers. It is now all but ruins.

locations.name: Solis Sanctorum
locations.description: The central church of Celestia, It now serves as the main church of the Second Light.

locations.name: City of Solis
locations.description: Once home to Celestia's original church. It has became the capital of the Second Light, remaining the heart of their power and belief.

locations.name: Bashan Wall
locations.description: An immense wall built by the Bastioners of Nox. It now begins to crumble.

locations.name: Furstwey
locations.description: A massive bridge built by the Bastioners of Nox. Tolls are collected from those crossing to help pay to maintaining it and the city.

locations.name: Furstholm
locations.description: The oldest inhabited city in Nox. It was built during the First Light as a stronghold from monsters from the north.

locations.name: Furst Cradle Windmills
locations.description: These mills serve both to grind grain into flour and to act as watchtowers against seafaring raiders.

locations.name: Zalt Cove
locations.description: Salt-heavy tides form brief crystalline pillars along the shore, reclaimed with each wave. Coastal caves exhale briny mist as the sea crashes within.

locations.name: Zalt'Elm
locations.description: An ancient tower-academy rising from a saltwater island, its stone soaked in sea-mist and crashing waves. Sanctioned by the old Church of Celestia, it remains the foremost authority on magic in Nox.

locations.name: Plunderer's Keep
locations.description: A long-abandoned castle from before the Zenith of Day, stripped over time for stone and treasure. Now, little remains but a hollow and scattered ruin.

locations.name: The Red Falls
locations.description: Iron oxide from the mountains freeze in the glacial lakes. As the snowy mountain caps melt, the waterfalls run red as though bleeding.

locations.name: The Candles (Eastern)
locations.description: Sedimentary rock formations, worn by time into towering, candle-like spires that stretch into the sea.

locations.name: The Candles (Southern)
locations.description: Sedimentary rock formations, worn by time into towering, candle-like spires that stretch into the sea.

locations.name: The Sea of Glass
locations.description: The crater left where Celestia fell. The sand has turned to glass for miles in all directions.

locations.name: The City of Rags
locations.description: A sea of tents surrounds the Reliquary, a makeshift city born from countless pilgrims drawn by faith. Struggling under the overpopulation, the city is ravaged by diseases like the deadly Scar Scale.

locations.name: The Reliquary
locations.description: The Reliquary is the Custodiate's stronghold, encasing the sacred body of Celestia. Nearly impenetrable, it stands as both the main church and the heart of the Custodiate's power.

locations.name: Dustmere
locations.description: Dustmere is the original city of the Godhold, where nobles and wealthy merchants remain. Those who couldn't adapt have fled or been swallowed by the city. Those who remain are amongst the richest in all of Nox.

locations.name: Faithguard Tower
locations.description: A tower built by the Custodiate to monitor the city and enforce law.
